name: barhopping
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the activity of going to a series of bars to have drinks in each, for pleasure: If you prefer bar-hopping to culture you'll find that Granada's nightlife is as exciting as its monuments. In some countries, people often go barhopping to unwind after a long day's or week's work.
More examplesFewer examplesFor bar-hopping head to the Quay area of town.The narrow lanes teem with people engaged in outdoor dining and bar-hopping.He had no enthusiasm for long, expensive nights of bar-hopping and clubbing.After three years of napping, online gaming and barhopping, he is considering joining the army. Prosecutors allege that he drunkenly assaulted his friend after a night of bar-hopping.
